info.name: CFS OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect
info.description:
This postman collection is used to try out the **OpenID Connect feature of CFS**. ## Pre-requisities - Configure an OpenID Connect Application in CFS. - Go to **Administration -> Applications -> OpenID Connect** - Click the "New OpenID Connect Application" button - Fill in the fields - For the Callback URL field, use the value: `https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/callback` - Fill in the Postman Collection Variables with appropriate values for `CFS Master URL`, `Tenant Name`, `client_id`, `client_secret`, `username`, and `password` respectively. Now you can test the OAuth requests directly in Postman. ## Collection Variables | **Variable Name** | **Current Value** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | CFS Master URL | {{CFS Master URL}} | The base URL for the CFS Master instance | | Tenant Name | {{Tenant Name}} | The name of the CFS tenant | | username | {{username}} | The username used to log in to the CFS Master tenant's portal | | password | {{password}} | The password used to log in to the CFS Master tenant's portal | | client_id | {{client_id}} | The client identifier
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.2) | | client_secret | {{client_secret}} | The client secret
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-2.3.1) | | scope | {{scope}} | The space separated list of requested scopes
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.3](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.3) | | state | {{state}} | State parameter used for protection against CSRF
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-10.12](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-10.12) | | nonce | {{nonce}} | Nonce parameter used for protection agaisnt replay attacks
[https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken) | | redirect_uri | {{redirect_uri}} | The callback URL configured for the OIDC Application
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.1.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-3.1.2) | | code_challenge | `{{code_challenge}}` | Code Challenge for PKCE
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.2](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.2) | | code_verifier | `{{code_verifier}}` | Code Verifier for PKCE
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.1) | | code_method | {{code_method}} | Code Challenge Method for PKCE
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.3](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7636#section-4.3) | | authorization_code | `{{authorization_code}}` | **This variable is managed by the Postman Collection itself, do not modify it manually!**

The OAuth authorization code
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-1.3.1) | | id_token | `{{id_token}}` | **This variable is managed by the collection itself, do not modify it manually!**

The OIDC Id token
[https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#TokenResponse](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#TokenResponse) | | access_token | `{{access_token}}` | **This variable is managed by the collection itself, do not modify it manually!**

The OAuth acess token
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1) | | refresh_token | `{{refresh_token}}` | **This variable is managed by the collection itself, do not modify it manually!**

The OAuth refresh token
[https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6749#section-5.1) | The "Authorize" requests will automatically set the values for the `authorization_code`, `id_token`, `access_token` collection variable(s), while the "Request for tokens" requests will automatically set the values for the `id_token`, `access_token`, and `refresh_token` collections variable(s) where appropriate. **N.B.:** The "Automatically follow redirects" setting must be **disabled** in Postman in order to run the requests in the "[Implicit Flow](https://speeding-sunset-964902.postman.co/workspace/CFS5~8ebc958a-523b-46bd-931a-968060aa59a4/folder/25667693-0adeda1d-0730-496d-b6d8-79fd4cb9ee10?ctx=documentation)" and "[Hybrid Flow](https://speeding-sunset-964902.postman.co/workspace/CFS5~8ebc958a-523b-46bd-931a-968060aa59a4/folder/25667693-38b7714c-3ef1-4f1f-9f42-14ac1e5d6c0b?ctx=documentation)" folders!
